required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of SHR-1210 Combined With Apatinib in the Treatment of Sarcoma
clinical_study.official_title: Anti-PD-1 Antibody SHR-1210 (Camrelizumab) Combined With Apatinib Mesylate in the Treatment of Unresectable Sarcoma With Chemotherapy Failure: an Open, Non-randomized Phase II Clinical Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Tianjin Medical University Cancer Institute and Hospital

clinical_study.source: Tianjin Medical University Cancer Institute and Hospital

brief_summary.textblock:
To observe the effectiveness of SHR-1210 (Camrelizumab) combined with apatinib in the treatment of unresectable sarcoma patients with chemotherapy failure. The main observations were progression-free survival (PFS) and progression-free control rate (PFR), followed by objective response rate (ORR) (CR+PR), disease control rate (DCR) (CR+PR+SD), and overall survival (OS).
To observe the safety of SHR-1210 (Camrelizumab) combined with apatinib in the treatment of sarcoma

primary_outcome.description: PFS is defined as the length of time from random assignment to disease progression or to death resulting from any cause other than the progress.

secondary_outcome.description: nvestigators will assess treatment response according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors 1.1（RECIST1.1）
ORR is defined as the percentage of subjects having achieved confirmed Complete Response + Partial Response as best overall response according to radiological assessments.
OS is defined as the length of time from random assignment to death or to last contact.

arm_group.description: Camrelizumab intravenous injection once every three weeks, Apatinib 500 mg is administered orally daily, until disease progression or untolerable toxicity.
Apatinib 500 mg is administered orally daily, until disease progression or untolerable toxicity.

intervention.description: Camrelizumab+ Apatinib test group: intravenous injection once every three weeks, Apatinib 500 mg is administered orally daily, until disease progression or untolerable toxicity.
Apatinib single drug control group: Apatinib 500 mg is administered orally daily, until disease progression or untolerable toxicity.

facility.name: Tianjin Medical University Cancer Hospital & Institute
